THE MOON

The first and most polular trip you can take part in is our lunar orbit and landing. Anyone can go outside at night or use a telescope to look at the moon, but to se all the crivices and craters up-close and to look at our home planet from over 200,000 miles away is an experience everyone should have in a lifetime. Moon rock is very safe to touch, so visitors can take as much as they want. You'll have a blast in this lunar land.

MARS

Mars is a planet that humans have wanted to inhabit for many years, and now, with our safe and cutting-edge technology, we have made that a reality. Our spacesuits will keep you warm and breathing on the red planet's cold, barren surface. Explore the beautiful mountains, canyons, and the newly discovered subterranean oceans, blooming with rich and vibrant aquatic life. Visitors can also take tours in one of our many potato farms on the planet's surface.

VENUS
Venus is one of our more unique Astrocruise experiences. The surface on the Planet can get up to 9,000 degrees Fahrenheit, so visitors will be given speciallized spacesuits. The surface is thick and sludgelike, so no walks on the surface will be permitted. Our navigation craft will take you through the yellow mountains and volcanoes, showing off the intensity of this beautiful, raging planet. If you're up for a bit of an adventure, our Venus trip is for you.

OGLE-2016
OGLE-2016 BLG-1928, or OGLE for short, is arguably our most interesting trip yet. OGLE is a rogue planet, meaning it doesn't orbit any one star. This little planet's atmostphere is interestingly very similar to that of our own, meaning it can support a biotic ecosystem of its own. This beautiful planet is home to many unique and breathtaking alien plants and species, making it perfect for those who have always wanted to shake the hand of a real martian. Although it is the most expensive of our selection, visitors will not soon forget visiting. OGLE.

OUR VESSELS

The Phoenix
With a capacity of 200 passengers, we pride ourselves on our ability to make a rocket feel like home. The propulsion engines and oxygen filtration system are the latest and safest in the industry, rivalling organizations as advanced as NASA.

The Lander
After flying to a planet, the Astrocruise Lander will take you down to the surface. Our gyroscopic stabilizers and balanced thruster technology will give visitors a smooth and easy landing.

Navigation Pod 1
Once landed on the surface of a planet, visitors will have the option to speed through the alien landscape in our sleek and simple navigator pods. For some dangerous trips like our Venus voyage, the tour will be exclusively confined to the nav pods.
